dict.string:
# this requires pdflatex Web2C 7.5.3 # for preview you also need the PDF Browser Plugin cat <<"EOF" 
EOF

tmp=`mktemp /tmp/pdflatex_XXXXXXXX`

# If TM_LATEX_MASTER not set use TM_FILEPATH
[ -z "$TM_LATEX_MASTER" ] &&
  export TM_LATEX_MASTER="$TM_FILEPATH"

cd "`dirname "$TM_LATEX_MASTER"`"
"${TM_TEX:=pdflatex}" -interaction=nonstopmode -file-line-error \
  -halt-on-error -output-directory /tmp \
  -jobname "`basename ${tmp}`" "`basename "$TM_LATEX_MASTER"`" \
  | perl -pe '$| = 1; s|^(\.?/.*?):(\d+):\s*(.*)$|$3|'

echo "
" # If PDF file is non-empty and apache is running, redirect. if [ -s ${tmp}.pdf ] && [[ $(ps -xca|grep httpd) ]]; then echo FILE_LOC="${PDFTEX_FILE_LOCATION:-~/Sites}/web_kit_workaround.pdf" WEB_LOC="${PDFTEX_WEB_LOCATION:-http://localhost/~$USER}/web_kit_workaround.pdf" cp "$tmp.pdf" "${FILE_LOC}" chmod 666 "${FILE_LOC}" echo "" elif [ -s ${tmp}.pdf ]; then echo "Error: Apache not running (we can no longer redirect to file://localhost/...)" else echo "Error: PDF file not written to disk" fi { sleep 30; rm ${tmp} ${tmp}.*; } &>/dev/null &
